contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Yabe'''|矢部町|Yabe-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Kamimashiki District, Kumamoto|Kamimashiki District]], [[Kumamoto Prefecture|Kumamoto]], [[Japan]]. On February 11, 2005 Yabe was merged with the village of [[Seiwa, Kumamoto|Seiwa]], also from [[Kamimashiki District, Kumamoto|Kamimashiki District]], and the town of [[Soyō, Kumamoto|Soyō]], from [[Aso District, Kumamoto|Aso District]], to form the new town of [[Yamato, Kumamoto|Yamato]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 11,820 and a [[population density|density]] of 39.88 persons per km². The total area was 296.42 km². ==External links== * [http://www.town.yamato.kumamoto.jp/ Official website of Yamato] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kumamoto Prefecture]] {{Kumamoto-geo-stub}}
